sops.title: Foundational Sprint
sops.description: High-level sprint that covers technical, architecture, speed, content audit, EEAT, and implementation as the first 4–6 weeks of a campaign.
sops.content:
The Foundational Sprint
The Foundational Sprint focussed on technical optimizations and website optimizations to ensure the website has nothing holding back the website from ranking in search. This process includes 3 major parts:
Technical website optimizations
Website architecture optimizations
Website speed corrections
Content audit
EEAT Optimizations
Implementation of changes
It's important to review the client's audit performed by our sales team. This will give you a head start on what to look for. You can find the audit inside of the Sales folder in Google Drive.

Owner:

2. Website Architecture Optimizations
Owner:
Optimized website architecture is essential for law firms to ensure easy navigation, improve user experience, and enhance SEO rankings. It helps search engines and users find information quickly, leading to better engagement, higher conversion rates, and increased visibility in search results.

sops.title: Website Technical Optimizations
sops.description: Comprehensive technical SEO audit and optimization process to identify and fix crawl errors, indexing issues, sitemap problems, and other technical barriers to ranking.
sops.content:
Website Technical Optimizations

Overview:
This SOP outlines the technical SEO audit process to identify and resolve issues that may prevent a website from ranking properly in search engines. Technical SEO forms the foundation of any successful SEO campaign.

Key Areas to Review:

1. Crawl Analysis
- Use Google Search Console to identify crawl errors
- Check for 404 errors, 500 errors, and redirect chains
- Verify robots.txt file is not blocking important pages
- Ensure XML sitemap is properly configured and submitted

2. Indexing Status
- Review index coverage report in Google Search Console
- Identify pages that should be indexed but aren't
- Find and fix pages that are indexed but shouldn't be
- Check for duplicate content issues

3. Site Structure
- Analyze URL structure for SEO best practices
- Check internal linking architecture
- Verify proper use of canonical tags
- Review breadcrumb implementation

4. Mobile Optimization
- Run mobile-friendly test
- Check mobile usability issues in GSC
- Verify responsive design implementation

5. Technical Elements
- Review meta robots tags
- Check hreflang implementation (if applicable)
- Verify schema markup
- Analyze page load speed

6. Security
- Ensure HTTPS is properly implemented
- Check for mixed content warnings
- Verify SSL certificate validity

Deliverables:
- Complete technical audit report
- Prioritized list of issues
- Implementation recommendations
- Timeline for fixes

sops.title: Website Architecture Optimizations
sops.description: Strategic improvements to site structure, internal linking, and information architecture to improve crawlability, user experience, and search rankings.
sops.content:
Website Architecture Optimizations

Purpose:
Optimize the website's structure to improve search engine crawling, user navigation, and overall SEO performance. Good architecture ensures that important pages receive proper authority and are easily discoverable.

Architecture Components:

1. Site Hierarchy
- Map current site structure
- Identify orphaned pages
- Create logical category organization
- Limit depth to 3 clicks from homepage

2. Internal Linking Strategy
- Implement hub and spoke model
- Create topic clusters
- Use descriptive anchor text
- Balance link equity distribution
- Add contextual links between related content

3. Navigation Structure
- Optimize main navigation menu
- Implement breadcrumbs
- Create footer navigation
- Add search functionality

4. URL Structure
- Use SEO-friendly URLs
- Implement logical hierarchy in URLs
- Avoid unnecessary parameters
- Use hyphens instead of underscores

5. Pagination and Filters
- Implement proper pagination tags
- Handle filter parameters correctly
- Use canonical tags appropriately

6. XML Sitemap Optimization
- Create comprehensive sitemap
- Organize by content type
- Update regularly
- Submit to search engines

Implementation Process:
1. Audit current architecture
2. Create architecture blueprint
3. Prioritize changes
4. Implement changes in phases
5. Monitor impact on rankings
6. Iterate based on results

Success Metrics:
- Improved crawl efficiency
- Better internal PageRank distribution
- Increased organic traffic
- Lower bounce rates
- Higher pages per session

sops.title: Website Content Audit
sops.description: Systematic review of all website content to identify high-performing pages, underperforming content, and opportunities for optimization or consolidation.
sops.content:
Website Content Audit Process

Objective:
Analyze all content on the website to determine what should be kept, updated, consolidated, or removed. This ensures content quality and relevance while improving overall site performance.

Audit Criteria:

1. Content Inventory
- Export all URLs from sitemap
- Categorize by content type
- Note word count for each page
- Identify publication/update dates

2. Performance Metrics
- Organic traffic (last 12 months)
- Keyword rankings
- Backlinks
- Engagement metrics (time on page, bounce rate)
- Conversion data

3. Quality Assessment
- Content depth and comprehensiveness
- Accuracy and timeliness
- E-E-A-T signals
- Duplicate or thin content
- Keyword targeting effectiveness

4. Technical Evaluation
- Meta titles and descriptions
- Header tag structure
- Image optimization
- Internal linking
- Mobile optimization

Content Actions:

KEEP:
- High-performing content
- Evergreen content with steady traffic
- Content with strong backlinks
- Recent, high-quality content

UPDATE:
- Outdated information
- Thin content that can be expanded
- Content with declining traffic
- Pages with good potential but poor optimization

CONSOLIDATE:
- Multiple pages targeting same keyword
- Related topics that could be comprehensive guide
- Duplicate or near-duplicate content

REMOVE/REDIRECT:
- No traffic and no value
- Completely outdated
- Low quality with no improvement potential
- Duplicate content

Implementation:
1. Create audit spreadsheet
2. Analyze each URL
3. Assign action (Keep/Update/Consolidate/Remove)
4. Prioritize based on impact
5. Create implementation timeline
6. Execute changes
7. Monitor results

Deliverables:
- Complete content inventory
- Performance analysis
- Action plan with priorities
- Updated content calendar

sops.title: EEAT Optimizations
sops.description: Strategies to demonstrate Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness to improve rankings in competitive or YMYL (Your Money Your Life) niches.
sops.content:
E-E-A-T Optimization Guide

What is E-E-A-T?
Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness are quality signals Google uses to evaluate content, especially for YMYL (Your Money Your Life) topics.

E-E-A-T Components:

1. EXPERIENCE
- Demonstrate first-hand experience
- Include case studies and results
- Add before/after examples
- Share real client testimonials
- Document actual processes used

2. EXPERTISE
- Highlight professional qualifications
- Display certifications and credentials
- Showcase industry recognition
- Publish thought leadership content
- Participate in industry events

3. AUTHORITATIVENESS
- Build high-quality backlinks
- Earn media mentions
- Get cited by industry publications
- Contribute guest posts to authoritative sites
- Develop brand presence

4. TRUSTWORTHINESS
- Display clear contact information
- Add detailed About page
- Include privacy policy and terms
- Show secure payment options
- Display trust badges and certifications
- Maintain transparent business practices

Implementation Strategies:

Author Pages:
- Create detailed author bios
- Link to professional profiles (LinkedIn)
- List credentials and experience
- Add professional headshots
- Include published works

Content Enhancement:
- Add author bylines to all content
- Include expert quotes and citations
- Reference authoritative sources
- Update content regularly
- Fact-check all claims

Website Elements:
- Comprehensive About page
- Team member profiles
- Client success stories
- Industry awards and recognition
- Professional affiliations
- Contact information on every page

Review Management:
- Encourage client reviews
- Respond to all reviews
- Display reviews prominently
- Address negative feedback professionally

Social Proof:
- Case studies with metrics
- Client testimonials with photos
- Industry partnerships
- Media features
- Speaking engagements

Measurement:
- Monitor rankings for YMYL keywords
- Track branded search volume
- Measure referral traffic
- Monitor review ratings
- Analyze content engagement

sops.title: Content Marketing
sops.description: Strategic content creation and distribution to attract, engage, and convert target audiences while supporting SEO objectives.
sops.content:
Content Marketing Strategy

Overview:
Content marketing supports SEO by creating valuable, relevant content that attracts links, builds authority, and targets long-tail keywords.

Content Planning:

1. Topic Research
- Identify target audience pain points
- Analyze competitor content gaps
- Use keyword research for topic ideas
- Review common client questions
- Monitor industry trends

2. Content Types
- Blog posts (educational, how-to)
- Guides and resources
- Case studies
- Infographics
- Videos
- Podcasts
- Tools and calculators

3. Content Calendar
- Plan 3 months in advance
- Balance topic clusters
- Align with business goals
- Consider seasonality
- Include update schedule for existing content

Content Creation Process:

1. Research Phase
- Analyze top-ranking content
- Identify search intent
- Gather expert insights
- Collect data and statistics

2. Outline Development
- Create comprehensive outline
- Identify keywords to target
- Plan internal linking opportunities
- Determine content format

3. Writing
- Follow E-E-A-T principles
- Write for humans first
- Include relevant examples
- Add visual elements
- Optimize for featured snippets

4. Optimization
- Optimize title and meta description
- Use proper header structure (H1, H2, H3)
- Include target keywords naturally
- Add internal links
- Optimize images
- Include schema markup

5. Publication
- Upload to CMS
- Add to sitemap
- Create social media posts
- Send to email subscribers
- Update internal links from related content

Promotion Strategy:

- Social media distribution
- Email newsletter
- Outreach to industry influencers
- Syndication opportunities
- Paid promotion (if applicable)

Performance Tracking:

- Organic traffic by post
- Keyword rankings
- Engagement metrics
- Backlinks earned
- Conversion rate
- Social shares

Content Refresh Strategy:

- Review content every 6-12 months
- Update statistics and data
- Add new sections based on new information
- Improve underperforming content
- Re-promote updated content

sops.title: Website Quality Audit: URL Actions
sops.description: Decision-making framework for handling different types of URLs discovered during website audits, including redirects, consolidation, and removal strategies.
sops.source_file: SEO SOP 006 - Website Quality Audit URL Actions.docx
sops.content:
Website Quality Audit: URL Action Framework

Purpose:
Provide clear guidelines for handling various URL scenarios discovered during website audits. Every URL should have a specific action plan.

URL Categories and Actions:

1. HIGH VALUE PAGES
Criteria:
- Strong organic traffic
- Good keyword rankings
- Quality backlinks
- High conversion rate

Action: KEEP & OPTIMIZE
- Improve content quality
- Enhance on-page SEO
- Strengthen internal linking
- Update regularly

2. UNDERPERFORMING PAGES
Criteria:
- Low traffic but good potential
- Decent backlinks
- Targeting valuable keywords
- Thin or outdated content

Action: UPDATE & ENHANCE
- Expand content depth
- Update information
- Improve optimization
- Add multimedia
- Strengthen CTAs

3. DUPLICATE CONTENT
Criteria:
- Multiple URLs with same/similar content
- Competing for same keywords
- Confusing to search engines

Action: CONSOLIDATE
- Choose canonical version
- 301 redirect duplicates
- Merge unique content elements
- Update internal links

4. OBSOLETE CONTENT
Criteria:
- Completely outdated
- No traffic for 12+ months
- No valuable backlinks
- No historical value

Action: REMOVE
- Set up 301 redirect to relevant page
- Remove from sitemap
- Update any internal links
- Consider 410 (Gone) if no suitable redirect

5. TECHNICAL ISSUES

404 Errors:
- Fix broken internal links
- Set up 301 redirects for valuable URLs
- Return 410 for permanently removed content

301 Chains:
- Update to direct redirects
- Fix source links when possible

302 Temporary Redirects:
- Change to 301 if permanent
- Remove if no longer needed

6. INDEXATION ISSUES

Wrong Pages Indexed:
- Add noindex tag
- Use robots.txt (carefully)
- Request removal in GSC if urgent

Missing Important Pages:
- Remove blocking directives
- Add to sitemap
- Improve internal linking
- Request indexing in GSC

Implementation Process:

1. URL Audit
- Export all URLs from crawl tool
- Categorize by type and status
- Add performance data
- Identify technical issues

2. Analysis
- Review traffic and rankings
- Check backlink profile
- Assess content quality
- Determine action for each URL

3. Prioritization
- High impact first
- Quick wins
- Technical fixes
- Content updates

4. Execution
- Implement redirects
- Update/remove content
- Fix technical issues
- Update sitemaps

5. Monitoring
- Track rankings
- Monitor crawl errors
- Verify redirects working
- Check traffic changes

Documentation:
- Maintain redirect log
- Track all URL changes
- Document decisions
- Create redirect map

sops.title: Link Acquisition
sops.description: Ethical link building strategies to acquire high-quality backlinks that improve domain authority and search rankings.
sops.source_file: SEO SOP 007 - Link Acquisition Link Building SOP.docx
sops.content:
Link Building & Acquisition Strategy

Objective:
Acquire high-quality, relevant backlinks through ethical white-hat strategies that provide long-term SEO value.

Link Building Strategies:

1. CONTENT-BASED LINK BUILDING

Linkable Assets:
- Comprehensive guides
- Original research and data
- Industry studies
- Infographics
- Tools and calculators
- Expert roundups

Process:
- Create exceptional content
- Identify linking opportunities
- Outreach to relevant sites
- Follow up strategically

2. DIGITAL PR

Tactics:
- Press release distribution
- Media outreach
- Expert commentary (HARO)
- Newsworthy content creation
- Industry award applications

Targets:
- Industry publications
- Local news sites
- Trade journals
- Relevant blogs

3. RESOURCE LINK BUILDING

Process:
- Find resource pages in your niche
- Identify broken links on resource pages
- Create/identify linkworthy resource
- Reach out with value proposition

4. BROKEN LINK BUILDING

Steps:
- Find broken links on relevant sites
- Create content to replace broken link
- Contact site owner
- Suggest your content as replacement

5. GUEST POSTING

Guidelines:
- Target authoritative, relevant sites
- Provide exceptional content
- Focus on value, not just links
- Build genuine relationships

Quality Criteria:
- Domain Authority 30+
- Relevant to your industry
- Real organic traffic
- Editorial standards

6. PARTNERSHIP & COLLABORATION

Opportunities:
- Industry partners
- Suppliers and vendors
- Professional associations
- Local business organizations
- Sponsorships

Outreach Process:

1. Prospecting
- Identify target sites
- Qualify opportunities
- Find contact information
- Research decision makers

2. Personalized Outreach
- Write custom emails
- Lead with value
- Be specific about request
- Keep it concise

3. Follow-up
- Wait 5-7 days
- Send polite reminder
- Add additional value
- Know when to stop

4. Relationship Building
- Thank those who link
- Share their content
- Maintain connections
- Think long-term

Link Quality Assessment:

Green Flags:
- Relevant to your industry
- Real organic traffic
- Editorial placement
- Natural anchor text
- Do-follow link

Red Flags:
- Link farms or PBNs
- Spammy sites
- Irrelevant niches
- Paid link schemes
- Over-optimized anchor text

Tracking & Reporting:

- Log all link building activities
- Track acquired links
- Monitor link quality
- Measure impact on rankings
- Calculate ROI

Tools:
- Ahrefs/SEMrush for prospect research
- Hunter.io for email finding
- Pitchbox/BuzzStream for outreach
- Google Sheets for tracking

sops.title: Link Quality Checklist
sops.description: Comprehensive checklist for evaluating the quality and value of potential backlink opportunities before pursuing them.
sops.content:
Link Quality Assessment Checklist

Purpose:
Evaluate potential link opportunities to ensure they provide SEO value and don't pose risks. Not all links are created equal.

Quality Criteria:

1. RELEVANCE (Weight: Critical)

✓ Industry Relevance
- Is the site in your industry or a related niche?
- Does it serve a similar target audience?
- Would the link make sense to a human reader?

✓ Content Relevance
- Is the linking page topically related?
- Does the context around the link make sense?
- Is it naturally integrated into the content?

Rating: High / Medium / Low
Minimum acceptable: Medium

2. AUTHORITY METRICS

✓ Domain Authority (Ahrefs DR or Moz DA)
- 50+: Excellent
- 30-49: Good
- 20-29: Acceptable
- Below 20: Questionable

✓ Domain Age
- 5+ years: Excellent
- 2-5 years: Good
- 1-2 years: Acceptable
- Under 1 year: Risky

✓ Referring Domains
- 1000+: Excellent
- 100-999: Good
- 50-99: Acceptable
- Below 50: Questionable

3. TRAFFIC ANALYSIS

✓ Organic Traffic
- Check Ahrefs/SEMrush traffic estimates
- Look for consistent traffic pattern
- Verify traffic is relevant/targeted

Minimum: 500+ monthly organic visitors
Red flag: Zero organic traffic

4. CONTENT QUALITY

✓ Editorial Standards
- Well-written, grammatically correct?
- Properly researched and cited?
- Original content (not spun/scraped)?
- Regular publication schedule?

✓ Content Depth
- Comprehensive, in-depth articles?
- Or thin, low-value content?

Rating: High / Medium / Low
Minimum acceptable: Medium

5. LINK ATTRIBUTES

✓ Link Type
- Do-follow (passes authority): Preferred
- No-follow (doesn't pass authority): Still valuable for traffic
- Sponsored/UGC tags: Appropriate use?

✓ Anchor Text
- Natural, varied anchor text?
- Avoid over-optimization
- Brand or partial match preferred

✓ Placement
- In-content (best)
- Author bio (good)
- Footer/sidebar (less valuable)
- Comment section (minimal value)

6. TECHNICAL HEALTH

✓ Site Security
- HTTPS enabled? ✓
- Valid SSL certificate? ✓

✓ Site Speed
- PageSpeed score 60+? ✓
- Reasonable load time? ✓

✓ Mobile Friendly
- Responsive design? ✓
- No mobile usability issues? ✓

7. SPAM SIGNALS (Red Flags)

✗ Spam Indicators
- Excessive ads or pop-ups
- Unnatural linking patterns
- Link selling/exchange offers
- Thin, low-quality content
- Foreign language (if not relevant)
- Adult content or illegal topics
- Malware or security warnings
- Duplicate content

If 2+ red flags: REJECT

8. LINK CONTEXT

✓ Surrounding Content
- Is content relevant and valuable?
- Are other outbound links quality?
- Is the link editorially placed?

✓ Page Purpose
- Legitimate informational intent?
- Not just a link directory?

9. OUTBOUND LINK PROFILE

✓ Other Outbound Links
- Links to quality sites?
- Reasonable number of external links?
- Not a link farm?

10. BUSINESS LEGITIMACY

✓ About Page
- Clear about page with real info? ✓
- Team members or author bios? ✓

✓ Contact Information
- Real contact details? ✓
- Physical address (if applicable)? ✓
- Professional email domain? ✓

FINAL DECISION MATRIX:

PURSUE if:
- Relevance: High or Medium
- Authority: DA/DR 30+
- Traffic: 500+ monthly organic
- Quality: Medium or High
- No major spam signals

CAUTION if:
- Relevance: Medium
- Authority: DA/DR 20-29
- 1-2 minor concerns
- Requires closer evaluation

REJECT if:
- Relevance: Low
- Authority: DA/DR below 20
- 2+ spam signals
- No organic traffic
- Poor content quality

Documentation:
- Record all evaluated opportunities
- Note decision rationale
- Track pursued links
- Monitor link quality over time

sops.title: Local SEO + GEO Optimizations
sops.description: Optimization strategies for businesses targeting local search, including Google Business Profile, local citations, and geographic targeting.
sops.source_file: SEO SOP 010 - Local SEO GEO Optimizations.docx
sops.content:
Local SEO & Geographic Optimization Guide

Objective:
Optimize for local search visibility to attract customers in specific geographic areas. Critical for businesses with physical locations or service areas.

Core Components:

1. GOOGLE BUSINESS PROFILE OPTIMIZATION

Profile Setup:
- Claim and verify listing
- Complete all business information
- Choose accurate categories (primary + secondary)
- Add detailed business description
- Set accurate service areas or location

Business Information:
- Business name (consistent with website)
- Complete address (NAP)
- Phone number (local)
- Website URL
- Business hours (including special hours)
- Services/products offered

Visual Content:
- Add high-quality photos (10+ minimum)
- Upload exterior/interior shots
- Include team photos
- Add product/service images
- Update photos regularly
- Encourage customer photos

Posts & Updates:
- Post weekly updates
- Share offers and events
- Announce news
- Add relevant photos
- Include call-to-action

2. REVIEW MANAGEMENT

Strategy:
- Request reviews from satisfied clients
- Make it easy (provide direct link)
- Respond to ALL reviews (positive and negative)
- Address negative reviews professionally
- Thank customers for positive reviews

Goals:
- Minimum 4.0 star average
- Steady stream of new reviews
- High review response rate
- Recent reviews (within 3 months)

3. NAP CONSISTENCY

Name, Address, Phone must be:
- Identical across all platforms
- Match website exactly
- Use same format everywhere
- No variations in business name

Where to Check:
- Google Business Profile
- Website footer/contact page
- Social media profiles
- Citations and directories
- Local listings

4. LOCAL CITATIONS

Top Platforms:
- Google Business Profile
- Bing Places
- Apple Maps
- Yelp
- Facebook Business
- Industry-specific directories
- Local chambers of commerce
- BBB

Citation Building:
- Submit to major platforms first
- Add industry-specific sites
- Include local directories
- Ensure NAP consistency
- Add rich information when possible

Citation Audit:
- Find existing citations
- Fix inconsistent information
- Remove duplicate listings
- Update outdated info

5. ON-PAGE LOCAL SEO

Location Pages:
- Create page for each location
- Unique content per location
- Embed Google Map
- Include local landmarks
- Add location-specific testimonials
- List local area served

Content Elements:
- Include city/region in title tags
- Add location to meta descriptions
- Use local keywords naturally
- Create location-specific content
- Mention nearby landmarks

Schema Markup:
- LocalBusiness schema
- Organization schema
- Location coordinates
- Service area
- Opening hours

6. LOCAL CONTENT STRATEGY

Content Types:
- Local news and events
- Community involvement
- Local guides and resources
- Area-specific services
- Local case studies
- Neighborhood information

Blog Topics:
- "Guide to [Service] in [City]"
- "[City] [Industry] Trends"
- Local event coverage
- Community partnerships
- Local success stories

7. LOCAL LINK BUILDING

Opportunities:
- Local news sites
- Chamber of commerce
- Local business associations
- Community event sponsorships
- Local partnerships
- .edu institutions (if relevant)
- Local bloggers

8. GOOGLE MAPS OPTIMIZATION

Ranking Factors:
- Proximity to searcher
- Relevance to search query
- Prominence (reviews, links, citations)

Optimization:
- Complete profile 100%
- Get more reviews
- Maintain accurate info
- Add regular posts
- Respond to questions
- Upload fresh photos

9. MULTI-LOCATION STRATEGY

For Multiple Locations:
- Separate page per location
- Individual GBP for each
- Unique content (no duplicates)
- Location-specific phone numbers
- Individual local citations

Location Page Template:
- Unique introduction
- Address with map
- Hours of operation
- Location-specific services
- Local team members
- Customer testimonials
- Directions and parking info

10. TRACKING & ANALYTICS

Metrics to Monitor:
- Google Business Profile insights
- Local pack rankings
- Map views and clicks
- Direction requests
- Phone calls from listing
- Website visits from GBP
- Review quantity and rating
- Local organic rankings

Tools:
- Google Business Profile dashboard
- Google Search Console (local queries)
- Google Analytics (local traffic)
- Local rank tracking tools
- Review monitoring software

Reporting:
- Monthly GBP performance
- Local ranking changes
- Review summary
- Citation status
- Local traffic trends
